intro: Lysimachia molokaiensis, commonly known as Molokaʻi knotweed, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Molokaʻi. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Lysimachia molokaiensis is notable for its limited geographic distribution and is considered a rare and endemic species.
